Articles.Content:
I'm only objecting specifically to the literal junkyard, with actual rusty junk in it, and the cheesy patched together scrap metal walls for the observatory and fuel tanks. Get rid of the junk cars and sewer pipe. Give the observatory simple wooden walls. Make the tanks out of metal plate, but welded together in a regular pattern. These changes will fix all the problems. Please.

Someone somewhere is totally hooked on the concept of Jeb's Junkyard and equipment found lying by the side of the road. If the new starting tech follows a similar theme, it could actually be quite nice. Otherwise it won't fit. But all things considered, I'll upgrade the junkyard as quickly as possible anyway. So what.

Hmmm..

All I will say is, I hope they look like they do now in sandbox. The models look like a poorly made mod..

Just sayin', you guys can do better.
Very nice, but I've to say most of the models - like trailer and the car wreck - does not match up with kerbals scale. They never could look out of the windows from inside...

I have never, ever liked the rusty junkyard aesthetic. Just look at examples of Kerbal engineering ingame, and it's clear these guys know how to build smooth and paint clean. Why would they tolerate baling wire and scrap metal?

I think the point here is that, while the kerbals can build well, at this point of the career game they don't have the funds to do so. Having said so, however, I do agree that it could look a bit better - some of the textures are below the game quality and the terrain looks particularly strange.

But there's one thing about KSP: if we think something can be improved, we can actually do it ourselves. After 0.90 comes out, instead of just complaining, I'd like to see the community come up with better models - an "improved upgradable buildings" mod, perhaps. If it's good enough, it could even replace the stock version futurely, as other mods have been implemented. Some may accuse the devs of being "lazy", but hey, Squad is a small studio and by allowing this level of community input, we end up having a better game.

The models look like a poorly made mod..

Just sayin', you guys can do better.

I mean, seriously:

See-through backface on the roof underside.

Small textures stretched over a massive object.

Weird cartoonish plank texture stretched across the terrain with no model.

This stuff.

No ambient occlusion, anywhere.

After bac9's amazing work, it honestly feels like a step back into the art style of version 0.18 .

I really hope these are heavy works in progress...

On the other hand, I do really like the "patchwork" rough roads, it's just the stuff that is filling them.

Absolutely fantastic!

Makes me want to start a new career with this mod installed... http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/74625

Took the words right out of my mouth....

This seems like a perfect add on for low tier development.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/58639-0-24-Bargain-Rocket-Parts-v1-1-Bust-out-the-duct-tape-we-re-going-to-space!

Ok I gotta say the mobile homes and sandbag barriers are pretty darn funny. Love this look for an early pre-upgrade KSC.

Sandbags cracked me up.

I disagree.

If you want realism, we'll start with airplanes and airplanes only.

This is Kerbal Space Program. Kerbal already know how to build and fly planes. Now they're going into space.

Thanks for the early peek, Squad. I like the motif, makes me think of the early days of the US space program in primitive conditions out in the middle of the desert while sticking to KSP's cartoony art style.
Kerbal Farm Program. Also need wooden parts, or even parts like in Bagrain Rockets.
Anyone else hoping one tier is the 'classic' red and white space center. Somewhere between junkyard and this new version of KSC

I love this (and I'll love it even more when SQUAD updates the textures), but a few questions. These may have been asked or answered at some point within the first six pages, but I only read two of them, so sorry if these points have already been raised.

1) Are early parts going to look crude and nasty? I fee like the parts made by "Jebediah's Junkyard and Space Parts Co." should be made out of scrap, and generally work poorly. (Also, I just realized that the nuclear engine was made by good ol' Jeb. Seriously, there's radioactive cores in the scraps bin?! )

2) Are these early bits and bobs going to be more easily destroyable? After all, even Grade-A Wood is more easily breakable than what the final space center currently has.

3) Out of all of the things I want most in 0.90 now, it would be several cows aimlessly wandering the early KSC. Think about all of the possibilities! They could eat the stuff in the sandbags over time, requiring replacements. They could be easily felled with a small projectile, to fulfill special contracts or to boost the amount of Snacks that the Kerbals would have. They would be able to live in the KSC barn, and you could see them chewing their cud in the VAB! Most importantly, they would lend the overall scene an even more homely appearance!

0.90: The Cow Update.

For the sake of pure silliness, please make this happen devs. Please...?

Edited November 8, 2014 by UpsilonAerospace

3) Out of all of the things I want most in 0.90 now, it would be several cows aimlessly wandering the early KSC. Think about all of the possibilities! They could eat the stuff in the sandbags over time, requiring replacements. They could be easily felled with a small projectile, to fulfill special contracts or to boost the amount of Snacks that the Kerbals would have. They would be able to live in the KSC barn, and you could see them chewing their cud in the VAB! Most importantly, they would lend the overall scene an even more homely appearance!

0.90: The Cow Update.

For the sake of pure silliness, please make this happen devs. Please...?

http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-29947409

2) Are these early bits and bobs going to be more easily destroyable? After all, even Grade-A Wood is more easily breakable than what the final space center currently has.

Max said yesterday in the SQUADCast that the lower tier buildings would be easier to destroy than the higher tier ones. He also said there would be "other benefits" to upgrading the buildings, but I don't recall him ever specifying any of those benefits.

Kerbal already know how to build and fly planes.

Then why does it take so long to crawl up the tree to things like wings and aircraft engines?

This is Kerbal Space Program. Kerbal already know how to build and fly planes. Now they're going into space.

Thank you.

My point was, this is a game about sending little green men into space in hilariously unsafe rockets (or, for some, in quite safe but otherwise hilarious rockets).

As educational this game is, I don't think it really goes for the (historical) realism bit. So, probes before manned missions? No. Not unless we start off with plane parts (as well). Because realism! We flew in the skies before we went to the stars! Just as we sent probes before we sent men up.

Agreed?

Cool!

Overall, I love the new buildings. I understand that the art team has been stretched trying to just finish the models for all of the buildings, and what SQUAD has is a great start.

That being said, I sincerely hope that the models (and especially textures) will get some much-needed polish before 1.0. Will you have a chance to bring the model quality up to par with most of the current space center buildings?

I like how the kerbal decided to put mobile home so close to the launch pad....

Kerbals never change!

ok, i already want mod that disables or replace all these ugly designs, also the man who design that and the man who approved that needs to be fired, simply because they are took the most idiotic idea (that they think were funny and good) over the most sane (and the only right one) - show the progression of space program as realistic and sane as possible, just it was in real life without all these ugly barns and "humor". why just make the buildings smaller than they are in the end? especially than we already have great designs? all this looks like a step backwards to versions before 0.20
I hope that one of the rewards for upgrading the Tracking Station is being able to discover more planets (you start out only seeing Mun and Minmus, then go on to see more planets).

I hope that one of the rewards for upgrading the Tracking Station is being able to discover more planets (you start out only seeing Mun and Minmus, then go on to see more planets).

That's actually a really good idea. +1

Anyone else hoping one tier is the 'classic' red and white space center. Somewhere between junkyard and this new version of KSC

That's actually a good idea, if the textures get a BIT of an overhaul as they were friggen ugly!

I'm on the side of liking this.

Awesome!

Love the look and style. Great job guys!

Now you only need to add alternate skins to low-tier parts. Can't just build a shiny high-tech rocket in a barn next to a cow. Or kow.

Totally agreed.

All I will say is, I hope they look like they do now in sandbox. The models look like a poorly made mod..

I know, it's like it's the very first art pass or something. Jeez, Squad.

Then why does it take so long to crawl up the tree to things like wings and aircraft engines?

Because the wings and engines we have access to are those for supersonic flight and are treated for use in vacuum and re-entry. The piddly junk they used in Kerbin War II are fine and all but are totally useless in a space program.

[/handwave]
Amazing

Wheres the fields, irrigation ditches, old farm equipment, the old windmill, the tree growing through a old car and the house?! I thought this was a farm, not part of a redneck paradise!

As i live in the midwest, the trailer park part of the facility feels really wierd.

(Although i love the rest of KSC)

Also, as a science experiment, can i launch a cow into space?

Edited November 8, 2014 by gooddog15
